H0.text: Series of colors of the rainbow describes the electromagnetic spectrum.

H1.text: List of radioactive elements is the description of the electromagnetic spectrum.

H2.text: Band of frequencies of light waves describes the electromagnetic spectrum.

H3.text: Range of conductivity of metals is the description of the electromagnetic spectrum.

A4.text: The electromagnetic spectrum is the full range of electromagnetic radiation, organized by frequency or wavelength.

A5.text: A rainbow shows the optical (visible) part of the electromagnetic spectrum; infrared (if it could be seen) would be located just beyond the red side of the rainbow whilst ultraviolet would appear just beyond the opposite violet end.

A6.text: The U.S. Frequency Allocation Chart covers the range 3 kHz to 300 GHz.
